content: welcome to my free butterfly spirit design us terms a friend of mine asked me to create a blanket with lots of butterflies and although it s not my usual sort of pattern i think it makes a beautiful blanket as my friend wanted the blanket to fit her bed i created quite large sections 109 stitches by 67/69 row and i used aran yarn so it was huge you can create placemats a wall hanging or blanket it s up to you there are 3 different patterns of butterflies so if you do place mats you could repeat your favourite the charts are at the bottom of this pdf a huge thank you to my amazing testers barbara gluck denise fondren and sue sweet when repeating the patterns start the repeat with row 2 the pattern has 3 charts with xs and fully written patterns for each design one repeat chain 112 2 repeats chain 221 which includes the anchor stitches and turning chain for your first row an overlay mosaic crochet design using us terminology all single_crochet goes through the back loop only and all double_crochet go through the front loop of the same colour 2 row below at the start and finish of every row will be a single_crochet stitch these are separate to the pattern and you will go through both loops of these stitches at either end i call these anchor stitches as every single_crochet is written as s and every double_crochet is written as d i hope that you find it as easy as i do you cut the yarn and alternate the colours with each row see the files in my facebook group hook and flow for more information on overlay mosaic crochet the link is at the end of the pdf using double knit yarn my tester barbara used 300m for the background colour and 250m for the detailed colour with each pattern so this gives you an indication for each section with dk yarn the measurements of each section repeat will be approximately 58/40cm with a size 3 75 hook please share your creations in my facebook group https //www facebook com/groups/809381026680096/ ref=share_group_link i love to see your work in my news feed it always brightens my day if you need any help either email me here athey sarah@outlook com feel free to sell or gift your finished projects please do not share the pattern i own the rights to the original pattern it is protected under uk copyright law and artistic works sarah x
